comment: I've had Professor Cato for a couple of classes now and can say that she is very passionate about teaching. Her exams are open note & she has engaging lectures. Although attendance isn't mandatory, coming to class is extremely beneficial because sometimes quiz questions are based on class lessons. Just prioritize her class & you should pass.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Inspirational

comment: Professor Cato has a great demeanor and is a great communicator. She has a very good handle on the course content for the class I took, so I imagine that the rest of her classes align in the same manner. I highly recommend her if she is listed as an instructor for any of your classes!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I took Professor Cato for Uses & Effects of Mass Media and I enjoyed it. She is fair and willing to work with you if you need help.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Mackenzie Cato is one of my favorite professors I have had at KSU! She gives great feedback and provided her students with everything we need to be successful. She's a great professor so I took two classes with her and made an A both times.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Easy A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: COMM2020 is a pretty boring class to teach, but she did her best keeping everyone engaged. I put a lot of effort into this class, and she gave some really nice feedback in return. Good work pays off; putting in the effort will get you an A or B, zero effort will get you a C or D.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I've had multiple classes with professor Cato so I decided to take this one too. This class is so annoying there are essay-style discussion posts reflecting over research articles every week and the research essay at the end felt so out of nowhere. I really enjoy her as a person and a professor but this class is just super annoying.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I've heard Professor Cato's in person classes are good, but online was not great. The material isn't hard, but the amount of reading per week (about 50-60 pages of academic journals + an hour of videos) as well as the length of writing required for the weekly discussions, it was way too much. Negatively impacted my performance in my other classes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I've had Professor Cato for two classes. She was great in Fundamentals of Media. I enjoyed her enough to take another class with her which was Gender, Race, and Media. That class was the hardest and most work I've had in my four years of college. I took this as an elective and while the content was interesting it was way harder than expected.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Never clear on her grading rubrics and everything was graded very harshly. she also wouldn't post our modules on time, usually days later and our deadlines would stay the same. her weekly discussions were very time consuming (think 10+ articles/videos). what I thought would be an easy class along with my others ended up being one of my hardest
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Sometimes Professor Cato gave good feedback, but other times she gave harsh feedback. There was one assignment that we thought was a group project, but it turned out to be an individual assignment. She refused to see how we thought that, and that was stressful. There are also lots of projects. She does allow a differing opinion, which is nice!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Prof Cato is pretty solid. I feel like she'd be much better in a face-to-face class. She genuinely wants you to learn the material and puts a lot of time into making sure the lectures are engaging. Tests are pretty difficult, so actually study (even tho they're open note). She grades her 'reflections' projects very easy. I'd take again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Cato is one of the worst professors I've ever had, especially online. She gives so much work, and grades so harshly for absolutely no reason. She's not clear at all on her grading, never answers emails on time, and is very rude and unprofessional in her responses. Do yourself a favor and don't take her class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Professor or should I say Doctor Cato is extremely content heavy. Much more than there should be. There were multiple occasions where a test and paper would be due the same week. Or a test one week followed by another test the next week. She is not very descriptive in her instructions for papers or projects and she grades these items rather hard.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She makes it super clear what you need to know for the tests. As long as you show up and pay attention/take quality notes, it's a free A. Book is not needed. 15 participation points, 1 per week, not per class, day is random. Very nice and understanding prof, abundant chances for extra credit. Makes students feel appreciated and respected.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She makes class super engaging! Attendance is important because she does not post her powerpoints. She does random participation assignments that get put in as grades. Dr. Cato is super passionate about her work! Overall, this is a great class.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Cato is great! The exams are based on the lectures, so if you do not go to class, you won't do well. Lectures are not posted online, attendance is not counted, and there are occasional participation grades where you turn in a short response at the end of class. Lots of extra credit through the semester and on the exam. Do not need book
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Cato is such a sweet woman who is so passionate about research. The class is not hard, but you have to keep up with everything she assigns to stay on track for the final research proposal. The biggest advice I have is to meet with her in her office hours because she will go over your specific paper with you and give you feedback.
rating_tags: Respected--Caring

comment: Professor Cato is honestly one of the best professors Ive ever had! Her tests are super easy and she makes the class fun and opens the floor up for discussion. Shes also nice and accessible outside of class. She offers a lot of extra credit opportunities for everyone through the semester. I wish I had her for all of my classes. Take this class!
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Professor Cato is one of the best professors I've had. She is very engaging and definitely understands her students. Actually enjoyed going to her classes, which is different for me. Go to class, you'll pass.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Cato is amazing. She will meet with you if you are confused and go over your work with you. I was terrified for this class, but she goes through everything thoroughly and wants to see you succeed. Try not to miss class because you will be so far behind. Get the writing handbook she mentions. It will help you throughout the semester!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Cato is AMAZING. Not only is she caring and funny. She will also teach you a bunch of interesting facts. She doesn't take attendance, but if you are someone who doesn't go to class don't take her cause you'll fail. But her classes are fun. 5 tests. Thats all. Tells you what will be on them in class, which is why don't go, won't pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Cato was super sweet. I had her once a week and each class was just going over the assignment due the next week, which was just one small part of a semester long project - a research proposal. Super easy, gives lots of explanation and help when you need it. Will accept emailed assignments if you have to miss class, easy grader. 10/10
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: This is my second time taking Cato, and i have learned that CANNOT WAIT to start on the semester long project because you will fail it and its worth 25% of your overall grade. Overall , this class is very in depth and informative and if you do the work, ask questions and PAY ATTENTION, you will be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Cato is awesome! She is very clear about what she expects from her students and is always willing to provide feedback on students work. She's a fair grader if she can tell you put in the work but has no patience for slackers. I enjoyed her class and I wouldn't mind having her for another course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I thought this class would be more interesting but oh well. There's a lecture & some form of participation assignment everyday so try not to skip too too much. She also plays a lot of videos that are test questions. First test is always the hardest, but as long as you actually complete the study guide yourself and you memorize it, you'll be ok
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This class was really intimidating at first & I felt lost for the first half of the course. Only test is the final but it's super easy. We spend the whole semester working towards three assignments due at the end of the semester. But as long as you come to class regularly and actually ask her questions when you're confused, you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Participation matters

comment: She really knows her subject. There is a lot of paperwork and a lot of it is due near the end of the semester. There are power points but you NEED to pay attention to what she is saying and write it down, if you do that you will come out of this class with an A. Attendance is only 10% but it would benefit you a lot if you come to every class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Cato is a really nice woman and clearly wants you to succeed. However she is also a really tough grader. Make sure you check, double check, triple check, and have someone else check your APA style. She'll take points off for anything. For such a sweet person, she is brutal when it comes to grading.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Cato is amazing. I took her last semester and she really changed my perspective on writing. She teaches a lot about APA styled writing. Make sure you do not skip her class. She gives out participation assignments each class so make sure you go. She does not give any tests. make sure to read her feedback on your assignments. :)

Awesome prof!! I found out I am taking her again and I got really excited! Really wants students to learn and know the material. I totally recommend her. She kinda took attendance (if she remembered) by us turning in a slip of paper with some we learned but not difficult. TAKE HER!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Participation matters

comment: A very logical, pragmatic woman; easy to talk to and very level-headed. Willing to work with you if you need it. Very easy on the eyes too! You can spend an hour right before class reading the chapter and answering the online REVEL questions and it will prepare you for the test right beforehand. Non-cumulative final! Very pleasant environment.

Cato was very chill and easygoing. She will help you if you need help on any of the major assignments in her class. The lectures are repetitive and you will really learn the material for the exam this way. The final project is a big one but she tells you exactly what she wants and her expectations.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Would take again

comment: Prof. Cato showed lots of videos/ ted talks during class and most classes had some sort of group work. She is lecture heavy but allows the class to have input.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY--Would take again

comment: Professor Cato cares a lot about her students and gives great feedback. If you try in her class and follow the rubric you will do well. She wants to see you succeed and will do what she can to help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Very quiet (and gets mad when you don't hear her starting class). Overall the class was low key. Just show up and listen (it gets very repetitive but you're graded on attendance so what can ya do). You are also graded on a few assignment throughout the semester and one research paper DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND DO THE ANNOTATED BIB THROUGH THE SEMESTER
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS
